verses.verse: When I would heal <WH7495> Israel <WH3478>, then is the iniquity <WH5771> of Ephraim <WH669> uncovered <WH1540>, and the wickedness <WH7451> of Samaria <WH8111>; for they commit <WH6466> falsehood <WH8267>, and the thief <WH1590> entereth in <WH935>, and the troop <WH1416> of robbers ravageth <WH6584> without <WH2351>.

And they consider <WH559> not in their hearts <WH3824> that I remember <WH2142> all their wickedness <WH7451>: now have their own doings <WH4611> beset them about <WH5437>; they are before my face <WH6440>.
They make the king <WH4428> glad <WH8055> with their wickedness <WH7451>, and the princes <WH8269> with their lies <WH3585>.

They are all adulterers <WH5003>; they are as an oven <WH8574> heated <WH1197> by the baker <WH644>; he ceaseth <WH7673> to stir <WH5782> the fire <WH3888>, from the kneading of the dough <WH1217>, until it be leavened <WH2556>.

On the day <WH3117> of our king <WH4428> the princes <WH8269> made themselves sick <WH2470> with the heat <WH2534> of wine <WH3196>; he stretched out <WH4900> his hand <WH3027> with scoffers <WH3945>.

For they have made ready <WH7126> their heart <WH3820> like an oven <WH8574>, while they lie in wait <WH693>: their baker <WH644> sleepeth <WH3463> all the night <WH3915>; in the morning <WH1242> it burneth <WH1197> as a flaming <WH3852> fire <WH784>.
They are all hot <WH2552> as an oven <WH8574>, and devour <WH398> their judges <WH8199>; all their kings <WH4428> are fallen <WH5307>: there is none among them that calleth unto me <WH7121>.
Ephraim <WH669>, he mixeth <WH1101> himself among the peoples <WH5971>; Ephraim <WH669> is a cake <WH5692> not turned <WH2015>.
Strangers <WH2114> have devoured <WH398> his strength <WH3581>, and he knoweth <WH3045> it not <WH7872>: yea, gray hairs are here and there <WH2236> upon him <WH3045>, and he knoweth it not.

And the pride <WH1347> of Israel <WH3478> doth testify <WH6030> to his face <WH6440>: yet they have not returned <WH7725> unto Jehovah <WH3068> their God <WH430>, nor sought him <WH1245>, for all this.
And Ephraim <WH669> is like a silly <WH6601> dove <WH3123>, without understanding <WH3820>: they call <WH7121> unto Egypt <WH4714>, they go <WH1980> to Assyria <WH804>.

When they shall go <WH3212>, I will spread <WH6566> my net <WH7568> upon them <WH3381>; I will bring them down as the birds <WH5775> of the heavens <WH8064>; I will chastise <WH3256> them <WH5712>, as their congregation hath heard <WH8088>.

Woe <WH188> unto them <WH5074>! for they have wandered from me <WH7701>; destruction unto them <WH6586>! for they have trespassed against me <WH6299>: though I would redeem them <WH1696>, yet they have spoken lies against me <WH3577>.

And they have not cried <WH2199> unto me with their heart <WH3820>, but they howl <WH3213> upon their beds <WH4904>: they assemble <WH1481> themselves for grain <WH1715> and new wine <WH8492>; they rebel against me <WH5493>.
Though I have taught <WH3256> and strengthened <WH2388> their arms <WH2220>, yet do they devise <WH2803> mischief against me <WH7451>.

They return <WH7725>, but not to him that is on high <WH5920>; they are like a deceitful <WH7423> bow <WH7198>; their princes <WH8269> shall fall <WH5307> by the sword <WH2719> for the rage <WH2195> of their tongue <WH3956>: this <WH2097> shall be their derision <WH3933> in the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.
